data.title: Bengaluru chic cricket training facility
data.meta_description: The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Secretary Jay Shah shared on August 3rd glimpses of the new National Cricket Academy (NCA).
data.text:
The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) Secretary Jay Shah shared on August 3rd glimpses of the new National Cricket Academy (NCA) in Bengaluru (India) stating that the “state-of-the-art facility” will soon be inaugurated.

‘NEWS 18’ stated that Shah posted a few pictures of the academy’s new look and also mentioned the facilities it will be providing to the cricketers of India.

The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is the principal national governing body of cricket in India. Its headquarters is situated at the Cricket Centre in Churchgate, Mumbai (India). The BCCI is the wealthiest governing body of cricket in the world. The BCCI is involved in talent development through grassroots programs and cricket academies. Its initiatives include infrastructure development, coaching and player welfare programs designed to maintain and enhance India’s competitive performance internationally.

‘NEWS 18’ further stated that taking to his social media handle, Shah shared photos of a couple of cricket grounds and practice pitches and said the new facility will provide the players with the best possible environment to develop their skills.

As per Shah’s post, the new NCA facility will have three world-class cricket grounds, a total of 45 practice turfs, indoor pitches, and much more.

Shah’s post read, “Very excited to announce that the @BCCI’s new National Cricket Academy (NCA) is almost complete and will be opening shortly in Bengaluru. The new NCA will feature three world-class playing grounds, 45 practice pitches, indoor cricket pitches, Olympic-size swimming pool, and state-of-the-art training, recovery and Sports Science facilities.”
